planning_goals.title: Architecture Guardrails
planning_goals.copilot_prompt:
Architecture guardrails for Crew-7:
1) Keep a clear separation between frontend, backend, and infrastructure code.
2) Prefer modular, small services and modules over giant files.
3) Public API surface should remain stable; breaking changes require explicit migration steps.
4) Observability (logs, metrics, traces) should be baked in, not bolted on.

Copilot: When suggesting architectural changes, keep them incremental and aligned with these guardrails.

planning_goals.title: MVP Focus Reminder
planning_goals.copilot_prompt:
MVP focus:
1) The MVP must let a user create or select a crew, run it, see a live Agent Graph, and inspect basic traces.
2) Secondary features (full billing, advanced integrations, complex evals) should not compromise or delay this core loop.
3) If there is a tradeoff between polish and working core, prioritize the core loop.

Copilot: When a change threatens to expand scope too much, propose a simpler version that keeps the MVP achievable.
